title: Apogee profit, sales fall less than expected
text:
Apogee Enterprises Inc. APOG, -0.65% Tuesday posted lower second-quarter profit as sales fell, though it beat Wall Street estimates.

The Minneapolis glass and metal products company reported a profit of $19.3 million, or 72 cents a share, down from $20.5 million, or 72 cents a share, in the prior year. Five analysts polled by FactSet were expecting 64 cents a share.

Sales fell 1% to $357.1 million. Analysts were targeting $352.5 million. The company said its architectural-framing systems and architectural services divisions contributed to the decline.

Apogee backed its fiscal 2020 guidance, expecting revenue to grow 1% to 3% and for per-share earnings of $3 to $3.20.
